original: Broms, Gustaf Adolf, landsfogde, Visby, f. 22/2/83 i Näsbyholm, Mal-möh. 1., av handl. Gustaf B. o. Nanna Hofvander. G. 19 m. Anna Carolina Ivarsson. Barn: Ann-Alarie f. 22, Margaretha 24. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 03, res:off:ex. 06, hovr :ex. 08. Und:-löjtn. i Södra skånska inf :reg. res. 06, löjtn. där 09. E. o. hovr :not. i Skånska hovr. 08, e. o. not. i Svea hovr. s. å., domsagotjg 09-11, landskansl. i Visby 10, länsnot. 18, landsfogde i Gotl. 1. sed. 19. Tf. rådman i Visby 09-15, sekr. i Visby stads byggnmd 09-18, led. av inskrivn ind 10-21, iLed. av lokak värder:nd f. Gotl. 1. »sed. 12, v. auditör v. Gotl. trupper 12-26, ordf. i tax:ndr o. i Gotl. L. Fiskeriförsäkr :-bol RNO, RVO.
translated: Broms, Gustaf Adolf, district governor (landsfogde), Visby, born 22/2/83 in Näsbyholm, Malmöhus County, first child of merchant Gustaf B. and Nanna Hofvander. Married in 1919 to Anna Carolina Ivarsson, with whom he had two children: Ann-Alarie, born in 1922 and Margaretha, born in 1924. He completed his student exam in Malmö in 1903, reserve officer's exam in 1906, and court clerk's exam in 1908. He was second lieutenant in the Southern Skåne infantry regiment during his reserve officer service in 1906 and became a lieutenant there in 1909. He served as deputy court clerk in the Skåne Court of Appeal from 1908, then as deputy court clerk in the Svea Court of Appeal the same year. From 1909 to 1911, he was a district court service clerk and became a county chancellor (landskansl.) in Visby in 1910. He was a notary public in Skåne and Svea Courts of Appeal, respectively, and was appointed county notary in 1918. In 1919, he became district governor (landsfogde) in Gotland, and served as acting councilman in Visby from 1909 to 1915. Additionally, he was secretary of the Visby city building committee from 1909 to 1918, member of the registration committee from 1910 to 1921, member of the local valuation committee for Gotland County from 1912, and acting auditor of the Gotland troops from 1912 to 1926. He was chairman of the tax committee and the Gotland Fisheries Insurance Company, and received the honours of the Order of the North Star (RNO) and Order of Vasa (RVO).
